item.title: States may meet federal deadline on new Colorado River water-sharing deal
item.description: About 40 million people rely on the Colorado River for drinking water. It also irrigates agricultural fields. It's also shrinking. Now, states might agree on a potential deal on sharing the river.

item.title: Why is the dollar off to a weak start this year?
item.description: The U.S. dollar had its worst start this year in more than half a century. Harvard University economics professor Kenneth Rogoff says President Trump is accelerating the decline.

item.title: Firefighters race to contain wildfires in Greece as thousands evacuated
item.description: More than 5,000 tourists, hotel workers and residents were evacuated from an area along Crete's southern coast. Some people fled into the sea and were rescued by local fishermen and divers.

item.title: Immigrants with no criminal convictions represent sharpest growth in ICE detention population
item.description: The number of people in ICE detention without criminal convictions nearly doubled in the last month — a significant increase compared to detainees who have been convicted of crimes.

item.title: Supreme Court to decide if states can ban transgender girls in sports
